about.description-overview: Taka is mainly developing online travel agency(OTA) system at Rakuten Travel. As an engineering manager, contributing service and organization development.
about.description-main: After graduated, Taka joined Rakuten and assigned Rakuten Travel Development. At international service development group, Taka developed hotel reservation system, extranet(provider system), accounting, inbound websystem as well. Working as Full-Stack engineer in while, but after 2017, Taka became Engineering Manager for UI/UX and FrontEnd fields. Then as Engineering Manager for UI Development Group (Web, iOS, Android), Taka contributed service, organization development. As freelance or in private, Taka is also doing product design, UI/UX design as well. Hobby is playing basketball and traveling. Favorites are coffee and alchol and Japanese food

name.tus-article: Tokyo University Of Science - Article(Science Forum)

titles.react-tokyo-plus: Large react product with 20+ FrontEnd Engineers in Rakuten Travel
titles.microservice-meetup: Microservices from Backend/FrontEnd point of view
titles.travel-spring: About Rakuten Travel and Spring Framework

react-tokyo-plus.1: is react meetup in Tokyo. This is a presentation in this meetup.
react-tokyo-plus.2: I did presentation with colleagues at Mercari. As title, our theme is how to build large scale react application with big organization. And material and presentation language is English.
react-tokyo-plus.3: This presentation is constructed with 3 chapters.
react-tokyo-plus.chapter2: Chapter 2 - Retrospective of project and remaining issue
react-tokyo-plus.4: I was in charge of chapter 2.
react-tokyo-plus.5: At least in Japan, as of 2018, 2019, there are not so many company, projects with 20 over front-end enginners. That's why we think our case study might be valuable for other company members, and we chose this topic. I mainly talked UI components library development and how to change our organization based on development phase.
react-tokyo-plus.6: Also I talked similar topic in different meetup and it's by Japanese.
